meanings.definition: Assume a posture or pose in order to impress others.
meanings.sent1: She was attitudinizing in front of the mirror, trying to look confident.
meanings.sent2: The actor was attitudinizing on stage, striking dramatic poses.
meanings.sent3: He caught his reflection attitudinizing comically and burst into laughter.

meanings.sent5: Her attitudinizing made her seem larger than life, like a character from a fairy tale.

meanings.definition: Behave in an affected or artificial manner.
meanings.sent1: Stop attitudinizing and just be yourself around others.
meanings.sent2: She was attitudinizing by pretending to like things she actually didn't.
meanings.sent3: His attitudinizing at the party was so obvious that everyone noticed.
meanings.sent4: The politician's attitudinizing made it hard for people to trust him.
meanings.sent5: The child was attitudinizing with exaggerated gestures, trying to seem grown-up.
